intro: Mesembryanthemum ampliatum, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers, which are often yellow or orange, bloom in the early morning and close by midday. Mesembryanthemum ampliatum is known for its ability to store water in its thick, fleshy leaves, making it well adapted to drought conditions.
